00022 /*
00023 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00024 
00025 The PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method produces
00026 an improved signal by accounting for experimentally observed patterns 
00027 in feature behavior and handling error at the appropriately at low and 
00028 high signal values.
00029 
00030 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00031 */

00069 inline
00070 void TransferVector(double *A, double *B, long Length)
00071 {
00072         for (long i=0; i<Length; i++)
00073                 A[i] = B[i];
00074 }
00075 
00076 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00077 inline
00078 void ScrambleTransferVector(double *A, double *B, long *Twist, long Length)
00079 {
00080         long i;
00081         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00082                 A[i] = B[Twist[i]];
00083 }

00085 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00086 inline
00087 void InitializeVector(double *v, long n, double fValue)
00088 {
00089         for (long i=0; i<n; i++)
00090                 v[i] = fValue;
00091 }
00092 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00093 
00094 double glog(double Value, double Offset)
00095 {
00096         return( log((Value + sqrt (Value*Value+Offset))/2));
00097 }
00098 
00099 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00100 
00101 double slog(double Value, double Start)
00102 {
00103         return( log (Value + Start));
00104 }

00109 void
00110 LogVector(double *Vector, long Length)
00111 {
00112         long i;
00113         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00114                 Vector[i] = log(Vector[i]);
00115 }
00116 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00117 
00118 void
00119 sLogVector(double *Vector, long Length,double start)
00120 {
00121         long i;
00122         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00123                 Vector[i] = slog(Vector[i],start);
00124 }

00126 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00127 
00128 void
00129 ExpVector(double *Vector, long Length)
00130 {
00131         long i;
00132         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00133                 Vector[i] = exp(Vector[i]);
00134 }

00136 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00137 inline
00138 void ShrinkVector(double *Vector, double *ShiftVector, long Length, double dropmax)
00139 {
00140         long i;
00141         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00142                 if (Vector[i]+ShiftVector[i] < Vector[i]/dropmax)
00143                         ShiftVector[i] = Vector[i]/dropmax - Vector[i];
00144 }
00145 
00146 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00147 
00148 void StepVector(double *Vector, double *ShiftVector, long Length, double lambda)
00149 {
00150         long i;
00151         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00152                 Vector[i] += lambda*ShiftVector[i];
00153 }

00157 inline
00158 void AugmentData(double **Matrix, long NumExperiments, long Numfeatures, double Safety)
00159 {
00160         long i,j;
00161         // ensure data is positive by adding small constant everywhere
00162         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments; i++)
00163                 for (j=0; j<Numfeatures; j++)
00164                         Matrix[i][j] += Safety; // small positive number
00165 }

00172                 data[i] += safety;

00185 long FitAdditiveModel(plier_data *pData, double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00186                            double **TestDataTable, double **Weight, double ssqlimit, bool bNoFeatureResponse)
00187 {
00188         long iter;
00189         long i,j, index, ti;
00190         //long medxval, medxvallo, medpval, medpvallo;
00191         double ssq;
00192 
00193         // do median polish by heapindex
00194         double median;
00195   // double *Val;
00196         // long *Rank;
00197         long ValSize;
00198 
00199         long nSize = pData->m_nAnalyses*pData->m_nFeatures;
00200   // this wont be freed at the end of the program.
00201   static double *Val = NULL;
00202   static int memSize = 0;
00203 
00204   if(nSize > memSize) {
00205     // free before reallocating
00206     delete[] Val;
00207     // now realloc scratch space
00208     Val = new double [nSize];
00209     if (Val == 0) {
00210       return NO_DATAMEM;
00211     }
00212     // remember the size.
00213     memSize = nSize;
00214   }
00215 
00216 //      Rank = new long [nSize]; // scratch space for rank
00217 //      if (Rank == 0)
00218 //      {
00219 //              delete[] Val;
00220 //              return NO_DATAMEM;
00221 //      }
00222 
00223         ssq = 10;
00224         for (iter=0; iter<pData->m_algParams->seaiteration && ssq>ssqlimit; iter++)
00225         {
00226                 ssq = 0;
00227                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses;)
00228                 {
00229                         index = 0;
00230                         for (ti=i; ti<pData->m_nReplicates[i]; ti++)
00231                         {
00232                                 // if replicates, would repeat this operation to load all values into Val
00233                                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
00234                                 {
00235                                         if (Weight[ti][j]>0)
00236                                         {
00237                                                 Val[index] = TestDataTable[ti][j]-FeatureResponse[j]; // copy the values
00238                                                 index++;
00239                                                 //Val[index] = TestDataTable[ti*pData->m_nFeatures + j]-FeatureResponse[j]; // copy the values
00240                                         }
00241                                 }
00242                         }
00243                         // Valsize is number of things loaded
00244                         ValSize = index;
00245                         if (index>0)
00246                         {
00247 //                              HeapIndex(Val, 0, Rank, ValSize);
00248 
00249 //                              // get median, subtract from column
00250 //                              medpval = (ValSize-ValSize%2)/2;
00251 //                              medpvallo = (ValSize-1-(ValSize-1)%2)/2;
00252 //                              median = (Val[Rank[medpval]]+Val[Rank[medpvallo]])/2;
00253                                          median = percentile_in_place(&Val[0], &Val[ValSize], 50);
00254                         }
00255                         else
00256                                 median = 0; // no data for this column, null model in output
00257 
00258                         // if replicates, would set TargetResponse[i] for each replicate
00259                         for (ti=i; ti<pData->m_nReplicates[i]; ti++)
00260                         {
00261                                 ssq += (TargetResponse[ti]-median)*(TargetResponse[ti]-median);
00262                                 TargetResponse[ti] = median;
00263                         }
00264                         i = pData->m_nReplicates[i]; //jump forwards by an appropriate amount
00265                 }
00266                 // WBS 04/02/2008 - Calculate the ssq first so we can break if needed, then calculate the feature reposnse.
00267                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures && !bNoFeatureResponse; j++) // only do this if updating FeatureResponses
00268                 {
00269                         // no replicate features
00270                         // but weights can zero out some features
00271                         index = 0;
00272                         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
00273                         {
00274                                 if (Weight[i][j]>0)
00275                                 {
00276                                         Val[index] = TestDataTable[i][j]- TargetResponse[i];
00277                                         index++;
00278                                 }
00279                         }
00280                         ValSize = index;
00281                         if (index>0)
00282                         {
00283                                 median = percentile_in_place(&Val[0], &Val[ValSize], 50);
00284                         }
00285                         else {median = 0;} // no data, null model this column
00286                         ssq += (FeatureResponse[j]-median)*(FeatureResponse[j]-median);
00287                 }
00288                 if ((pData->m_algParams->FixFeatureEffect) && (ssq <= ssqlimit)) {break;}
00289                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures && !bNoFeatureResponse; j++) // only do this if updating FeatureResponses
00290                 {
00291                         // no replicate features
00292                         // but weights can zero out some features
00293                         index = 0;
00294                         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
00295                         {
00296                                 if (Weight[i][j]>0)
00297                                 {
00298                                         Val[index] = TestDataTable[i][j]- TargetResponse[i];
00299                                         index++;
00300                                         //Val[i] = TestDataTable[i*pData->m_nFeatures+j]- TargetResponse[i];
00301                                 }
00302                         }
00303                         ValSize = index;
00304                         if (index>0)
00305                         {
00306 //                              HeapIndex(Val, 0, Rank, ValSize);
00307 //                              // get median, subtract from column
00308 //                              medxval = (ValSize-ValSize%2)/2;
00309 //                              medxvallo = (ValSize-1-(ValSize-1)%2)/2;
00310 //                              median = (Val[Rank[medxval]]+Val[Rank[medxvallo]])/2;
00311                                                   median = percentile_in_place(&Val[0], &Val[ValSize], 50);
00312                         }
00313                         else {median = 0;} // no data, null model this column
00314                         FeatureResponse[j] = median;
00315                 }
00316         }
00317 
00318            //   delete[] Val;
00319            //   delete[] Rank;
00320 
00321         if (iter==pData->m_algParams->seaiteration && ssq>ssqlimit)
00322                 return MAXIT_SEA_REACHED;
00323         else
00324                 return NO_PLIER_ERROR;
00325 }

00327 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00328 
00329 void BalanceFeatureResponse(double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00330                                          long NumExperiments, long Numfeatures)
00331 {
00332         double total;
00333         long i,j;
00334 
00335         // balance FeatureResponses for identifiability - crude - should build in at top?
00336         total = 0;
00337         for (j=0; j<Numfeatures; j++)
00338                 total += FeatureResponse[j];
00339         total /= Numfeatures;
00340 
00341         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments; i++)
00342                 TargetResponse[i] *= total;
00343         for (j=0; j<Numfeatures; j++)
00344                 FeatureResponse[j] /=total;
00345 }
00346 
00347 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00348 
00349 void BalanceMedianFeatureResponse(double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse, long NumExperiments, long Numfeatures)
00350 {
00351         // does this once at end if selected flag
00352   //    long *TmpRank;
00353         double med; 
00354            //   long v, vlo,i,j;
00355            int i,j;
00356 //      TmpRank = new long [Numfeatures];
00357 //      HeapIndex(FeatureResponse, 0,TmpRank, Numfeatures);
00358 //      v = (Numfeatures-Numfeatures%2)/2;
00359 //      vlo = (Numfeatures-1-(Numfeatures-1)%2)/2;
00360 //          median = (FeatureResponse[TmpRank[v]]+FeatureResponse[TmpRank[vlo]])/2;
00361         med = median(&FeatureResponse[0], &FeatureResponse[Numfeatures]);
00362 
00363         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments; i++)
00364                 TargetResponse[i] *= med;
00365         for (j=0; j<Numfeatures; j++)
00366                 FeatureResponse[j] /=med;
00367            //   delete[] TmpRank;
00368 }

00371 
00372 double ComputeSignalSize(double *TargetResponse, long NumExperiments)
00373 {
00374         // compute reasonable values
00375         double sum;
00376         long i;
00377         sum = 0;
00378         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments; i++)
00379                 sum += TargetResponse[i];
00380         sum /= NumExperiments;
00381         return(sum);
00382 }
00383 
00384 /////////////////////
00385 void BalanceSignalSize(double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse, long NumExperiments, long Numfeatures, double SignalSize)
00386 {
00387         // does this once at end if selected flag
00388         double sum,med; 
00389         int i,j;
00390 
00391         sum = ComputeSignalSize(TargetResponse, NumExperiments);
00392 
00393         med = SignalSize/sum;
00394         // never increase the average signal based on robust measure
00395         // only decrease to maintain approximate balance
00396         if (med>1)
00397                 med =1;
00398 
00399         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments; i++)
00400                 TargetResponse[i] *= med;
00401         for (j=0; j<Numfeatures; j++)
00402                 FeatureResponse[j] /=med;
00403 }

00405 
00406 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00407 // Y = I-B
00408 // U = glog(Y,H)
00409 // SEA: :"additive model"
00410 // SEA trick: H = 4*I*B*L (attenuated background)
00411 // V = log(f) + log(t)
00412 // R = U-V
00413 // minimize abs(R) by Median Polish
00414 
00415 long doSEA(plier_data *pData, double* TargetResponse,
00416                    double* FeatureResponse, double **U, double **Weight, bool bNoFeatureResponse)
00417 {
00418         long i,j;
00419         double fFourTimesAttenuation = 4*pData->m_algParams->attenuation;
00420         // initialize data using safety factor added to the logarithm
00421         // when using input feature responses, could be zero due to rounding
00422         // better than nothing!
00423         //double safetyzeta = .000001;
00424 
00425         // set up the (glog) transformed intensity minus background matrix 
00426         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
00427                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
00428                 {
00429                         U[i][j] = glog(pData->m_fPM[i][j] - pData->m_fMM[i][j],fFourTimesAttenuation*pData->m_fPM[i][j]*pData->m_fMM[i][j]);
00430                 }
00431 
00432         // additive model on log scale
00433         sLogVector(TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00434         sLogVector(FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00435 
00436         long lRes = FitAdditiveModel(pData, TargetResponse, FeatureResponse, U, Weight, pData->m_algParams->seaconvergence, bNoFeatureResponse);
00437         if (lRes != NO_PLIER_ERROR)
00438                 return lRes;
00439 
00440         // return to regular data scale
00441         // note: explicitly ignoring the fact that safetyzero has been added
00442         ExpVector(TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
00443         ExpVector(FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
00444 
00445         // balance our data
00446         BalanceFeatureResponse(TargetResponse, FeatureResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_nFeatures);
00447 
00448         return NO_PLIER_ERROR;
00449 }
00450 
00451 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00452 inline
00453 double GenerateReferenceForX(double *X, long Length, double safetyZero)
00454 {
00455         long i;
00456         // use slog in case reference contains zero values
00457         // due to rounding in input values
00458         // note: may add twice, but still fine
00459         double total=0;
00460         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00461                 total += slog(X[i],safetyZero); // logarithm of X
00462         total /= Length;
00463         total = exp(total); // geometric mean
00464         return(total); // geometric mean
00465 }
00466 
00467 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00468 double JustError(double TargetResponse,
00469                    double FeatureResponse,
00470                    double Hash, double PM, double MM, bool bUseGlog)
00471 {
00472         double f, t, y, e;
00473 
00474         if (bUseGlog)
00475         {
00476            f = FeatureResponse;
00477          t = TargetResponse;
00478          y = f * t;
00479          //q = sqrt (y * y + Hash);
00480          //r = (y + q) / (2 * PM);
00481          //e = log (r);
00482           // note glog(PM-MM, Hash) = log(PM)
00483           e = glog(y,Hash)-log(PM);
00484         }
00485         else  // slog
00486         {
00487          f = FeatureResponse;
00488          t = TargetResponse;
00489          y = f * t;
00490          //r = (y + MM) / PM;
00491          //e = log (r);
00492           // note slog(PM-MM,MM) = log(PM)
00493           e = slog(y,MM) - log(PM);
00494         }
00495         return(e);
00496 }
00497 
00498 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00499 
00500 double JustFit(double TargetResponse, double FeatureResponse, double Hash, double PM, double MM, double z, bool bUseGlog)
00501 {
00502         double e;
00503 
00504         e = JustError(TargetResponse, FeatureResponse, Hash, PM, MM, bUseGlog);
00505         return(e*e/(1+e*e/z));
00506 }
00507 
00508 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00509 // drop derivatives for compute speed
00510 // do not reformulate glog in case of rounding issues
00511 inline
00512 void JustPLIERMMLikelihood(double *Likelihood,
00513                                   double TargetResponse,
00514                                   double FeatureResponse,
00515                                   double Hash,
00516                                   double PM,
00517                                   double MM,
00518                                   double z, bool bUseGlog)
00519 {
00520         double f,t,y,q,r,e,x,esq;
00521 
00522         if (bUseGlog)
00523         {
00524                 f = FeatureResponse;
00525                 t = TargetResponse;
00526                 y = f*t;
00527                 // unrolling the computation for efficiency, since I need q later 
00528                 q = sqrt(y*y+Hash);
00529                 r = (y+q)/(2*PM);
00530                 // e = glog(y,Hash)-glog(PM-MM,Hash) = glog(y,Hash)-log(PM)
00531                 // but nicer to take logs of things near 1 (when we fit)
00532                 e = log(r);
00533 
00534                 // Geman-McClure
00535                 esq = e*e;
00536                 x = 1+(esq)/z;
00537                 // h = g^2/(1+g^2/z)
00538                 *Likelihood = esq/x;
00539         }
00540         else  // use slog
00541         {
00542                 f = FeatureResponse;
00543                 t = TargetResponse;
00544                 y = f*t;
00545                 r = (y+MM)/PM;
00546 
00547                 // e = slog(y,MM)-slog(PM-MM,MM) = slog(y,MM)-log(PM)
00548                 e = log(r);
00549 
00550                 // Geman-McClure
00551                 esq = e*e;
00552                 x = 1+esq/z;
00553 
00554                 *Likelihood = esq/x;
00555         }
00556 }
00557 
00558 
00559 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00560 inline
00561 void PLIERMMLikelihood(double *Likelihood,
00562                                   double *TDeriv,
00563                                   double *FDeriv,
00564                                   double *TGrad,
00565                                   double *FGrad,
00566                                   double TargetResponse,
00567                                   double FeatureResponse,
00568                                   double Hash,
00569                                   double PM,
00570                                   double MM,
00571                                   double z, bool bUseGlog)
00572 {
00573         double f,t,y,q,r,e,x,dh,dgT,dgF,ddh, xsq, esq;
00574 
00575         if (bUseGlog)
00576         {
00577                 f = FeatureResponse;
00578                 t = TargetResponse;
00579                 y = f*t;
00580                 // unrolling the computation for efficiency, since I need q later 
00581                 q = sqrt(y*y+Hash);
00582                 r = (y+q)/(2*PM);
00583                 // e = glog(y,Hash)-glog(PM-MM,Hash) = glog(y,Hash)-log(PM)
00584                 e = log(r);
00585 
00586                 // Geman-McClure
00587                 esq = e*e;
00588                 x = 1+(esq)/z;
00589                 xsq = x*x;
00590                 // h = g^2/(1+g^2/z)
00591                 *Likelihood = esq/x;
00592         // give me the likelihood I need
00593                 dh = (2*e)/xsq;
00594 
00595                 // dh = 2g dg
00596                 //df = 2*e;
00597 
00598                 // dg = 1/r dr
00599                 // dr = (f/q)r
00600                 dgT = f/q;
00601                 dgF = t/q;
00602                 *TDeriv = dh*dgT;
00603                 *FDeriv = dh*dgF;
00604 
00605                 // d^2h = 2g/(1+g^2/z)^2 d^2g + 2[3*(1+g^2/z)-4]/(1+g^2/z)^3 (dg)^2
00606                 // drop negatives to get a useful gradient
00607                 ddh = 2/xsq;
00608 
00609                 *TGrad = ddh*(dgT*dgT);
00610                 *FGrad = ddh*(dgF*dgF);
00611         }
00612         else  // use slog
00613         {
00614                 f = FeatureResponse;
00615                 t = TargetResponse;
00616                 y = f*t;
00617                 r = (y+MM)/PM;
00618 
00619                 // e = slog(y,MM)-slog(PM-MM,MM) = slog(y,MM)-log(PM)
00620                 e = log(r);
00621 
00622                 // Geman-McClure
00623                 esq = e*e;
00624                 x = 1+esq/z;
00625                 xsq = x*x;
00626 
00627                 *Likelihood = esq/x;
00628                 dh = (2*e)/xsq;
00629 
00630                 // 1/r dr = PM/(y+MM)*f/PM = f/(y+MM)
00631                 dgT = f/(y+MM);
00632                 dgF = t/(y+MM);
00633 
00634                 *TDeriv = dh*dgT;
00635                 *FDeriv = dh*dgF;
00636 
00637                 ddh = 2/xsq;
00638                 *TGrad = ddh*(dgT*dgT);
00639                 *FGrad = ddh*(dgF*dgF);
00640         }
00641 }
00642 
00643 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00644 inline
00645 void RoughnessPenaltyForX(double *LocalLikelihood, double *Deriv, double *Grad, double X, double Reference, double alpha, double alpha_times_2, double safetyZero)
00646 {
00647         // some function of a TargetResponse against a reference level
00648         double green;
00649         double Y;
00650         Y = X + safetyZero;
00651         //double alpha_times_2=alpha*2;
00652         // reference as computed should already have safety factor
00653         green = Y/Reference;
00654         double loggreen = log(green);
00655         *LocalLikelihood = alpha*loggreen*loggreen;
00656         *Deriv = alpha_times_2*loggreen/Y;
00657         *Grad = alpha_times_2/(Y*Y);
00658 }
00659 
00660 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00661 inline
00662 double UpdateLikelihoodForRoughness(double *X, double *XDeriv, double *XGrad, long Length, double penalty, double Reference, double safetyZero)
00663 {
00664         double  LocalLikelihood, Deriv, Grad, LogLikelihood;
00665         long i;
00666         LogLikelihood = 0;
00667 
00668         // do not compute reference here, to uncouple likelihood
00669         double penalty_times_2 = penalty*2;
00670         for (i=0; i<Length; i++)
00671         {
00672                 RoughnessPenaltyForX(&LocalLikelihood,&Deriv, &Grad,X[i],Reference,penalty,penalty_times_2, safetyZero);
00673                 LogLikelihood += LocalLikelihood;
00674                 XDeriv[i] += Deriv;
00675                 XGrad[i] += Grad;
00676         }
00677         return(LogLikelihood);
00678 }
00679 
00680 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00681 inline
00682 double ComputeGlobalLikelihood(plier_data* pData, double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00683                                                            double *NewtonTDeriv, double *NewtonFDeriv, double *NewtonTGrad, double *NewtonFGrad,
00684                                                            double **IHash, double **Weight, int NoDerivative)
00685 {
00686         double LogLikelihood, LocalLikelihood;
00687         double TDeriv, FDeriv, TGrad, FGrad;
00688         long i,j;
00689         double ReferenceFeatureResponse, ReferenceTargetResponse;
00690 
00691         LogLikelihood = 0;
00692         memset(NewtonTDeriv, 0, pData->m_nAnalyses*sizeof(double));
00693         memset(NewtonTGrad, 0,  pData->m_nAnalyses*sizeof(double));
00694         memset(NewtonFDeriv, 0, pData->m_nFeatures*sizeof(double));
00695         memset(NewtonFGrad, 0, pData->m_nFeatures*sizeof(double));
00696 
00697         if (!NoDerivative)
00698         {
00699         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
00700                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
00701                 {
00702                         PLIERMMLikelihood(&LocalLikelihood, &TDeriv, &FDeriv, &TGrad, &FGrad,
00703                                 TargetResponse[i], FeatureResponse[j], IHash[i][j],
00704                                 pData->m_fPM[i][j], pData->m_fMM[i][j],
00705                                 pData->m_algParams->gmcutoff, pData->m_algParams->usemm);
00706                         LogLikelihood += Weight[i][j]*LocalLikelihood;
00707                         NewtonTDeriv[i] += Weight[i][j]*TDeriv;
00708                         NewtonFDeriv[j] += Weight[i][j]*FDeriv;
00709                         NewtonTGrad[i] += Weight[i][j]*TGrad;
00710                         NewtonFGrad[j] += Weight[i][j]*FGrad;
00711                 }
00712         }
00713         else
00714         {
00715         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
00716                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
00717                 {
00718                         JustPLIERMMLikelihood(&LocalLikelihood,
00719                                 TargetResponse[i], FeatureResponse[j], IHash[i][j],
00720                                 pData->m_fPM[i][j], pData->m_fMM[i][j],
00721                                 pData->m_algParams->gmcutoff, pData->m_algParams->usemm);
00722                         LogLikelihood += Weight[i][j]*LocalLikelihood;
00723                 }
00724         }
00725 
00726         ReferenceFeatureResponse = GenerateReferenceForX(FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00727         ReferenceTargetResponse = GenerateReferenceForX(TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00728 
00729         LogLikelihood += UpdateLikelihoodForRoughness(FeatureResponse, NewtonFDeriv, NewtonFGrad,
00730                                                 pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->differentialfeaturepenalty, ReferenceFeatureResponse, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00731         LogLikelihood += UpdateLikelihoodForRoughness(TargetResponse, NewtonTDeriv, NewtonTGrad,
00732                                                 pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->differentialtargetpenalty, ReferenceTargetResponse, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00733 
00734         return(LogLikelihood);
00735 }
00736 
00737 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00738 
00739 void Join_Replicates(long *Replicate, double *NewtonTDeriv, double *NewtonTGrad, long NumExperiments)
00740 {
00741         long i, ti, NumRep;
00742         double TDeriv;
00743         double TGrad;
00744 
00745         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments;)
00746         {
00747                 TDeriv = TGrad = 0;
00748                 for (ti=i; ti<Replicate[i]; ti++)
00749                 {
00750                         TDeriv += NewtonTDeriv[ti];
00751                         TGrad += NewtonTGrad[ti];
00752                 }
00753                 NumRep = Replicate[i]-i;
00754                 TDeriv /= NumRep;
00755                 TGrad /= NumRep;
00756                 for (ti=i; ti<Replicate[i]; ti++)
00757                 {
00758                         NewtonTDeriv[ti] = TDeriv;
00759                         NewtonTGrad[ti] = TGrad;
00760                 }
00761                 i = Replicate[i];
00762         }
00763 }
00764 
00765 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00766 
00767 double ComputeExperimentLogLikelihood(plier_data *pData,
00768                                                                           double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00769                                                                           double *NewtonTDeriv, double *NewtonTGrad,
00770                                                                           double **IHash, double **Weight, long WhichExp)
00771 {
00772         double ReferenceTargetResponse;
00773         double LocalLikelihood;
00774         double LogLikelihood;
00775         long j, ti;
00776 
00777 
00778         ReferenceTargetResponse = GenerateReferenceForX(TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00779 
00780         // for each experimental replicate
00781         LogLikelihood = 0;
00782         for (ti=WhichExp; ti<pData->m_nReplicates[WhichExp]; ti++)
00783         {
00784                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
00785                 {
00786                         JustPLIERMMLikelihood(&LocalLikelihood, 
00787                                 TargetResponse[ti], FeatureResponse[j], IHash[ti][j],
00788                                 pData->m_fPM[ti][j], pData->m_fMM[ti][j],
00789                                 pData->m_algParams->gmcutoff, pData->m_algParams->usemm);
00790                         LogLikelihood += Weight[ti][j]*LocalLikelihood;
00791                 }
00792         }
00793         // roughness penalty over all experiments
00794         LogLikelihood += UpdateLikelihoodForRoughness(TargetResponse, NewtonTDeriv, NewtonTGrad,
00795                                                 pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->differentialtargetpenalty, ReferenceTargetResponse, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00796         return(LogLikelihood);
00797 }
00798 
00799 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00800 
00801 double ComputefeatureLogLikelihood(plier_data* pData,
00802                                                                  double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00803                                                                  double *NewtonFDeriv, double *NewtonFGrad,
00804                                                                  double **IHash, double **Weight, long Whichfeature)
00805 {
00806         double ReferenceFeatureResponse;
00807         double  LocalLikelihood;
00808         double LogLikelihood;
00809         long i;
00810 
00811         ReferenceFeatureResponse = GenerateReferenceForX(FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00812         // for each feature generate default values
00813         LogLikelihood = 0;
00814         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
00815         {
00816                 JustPLIERMMLikelihood(&LocalLikelihood, 
00817                                 TargetResponse[i], FeatureResponse[Whichfeature], IHash[i][Whichfeature],
00818                                 pData->m_fPM[i][Whichfeature], pData->m_fMM[i][Whichfeature],
00819                                 pData->m_algParams->gmcutoff, pData->m_algParams->usemm);
00820                 LogLikelihood += Weight[i][Whichfeature]*LocalLikelihood;
00821         }
00822         LogLikelihood += UpdateLikelihoodForRoughness(FeatureResponse, NewtonFDeriv, NewtonFGrad,
00823                                                 pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->differentialfeaturepenalty, ReferenceFeatureResponse, pData->m_algParams->safetyZero);
00824         return(LogLikelihood);
00825 }
00826 
00827 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00828 long SearchExperimentGrid(plier_data* pData, double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00829                                            double *NewtonTDeriv, double *NewtonTGrad, double *NewtonFDeriv, double *NewtonFGrad,
00830                                            double **IHash, double **Weight,
00831                                            double epsilon, bool bNoFeatureResponse)
00832 {
00833         long i,j, ti, tti;
00834         double trialval, oldval;
00835         double oldLogLikelihood;
00836         double LogLikelihood;
00837         long converged;
00838 
00839         converged = 1;
00840         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses;)
00841         {
00842                 // for each replicate group compute best old likelihood
00843                 oldLogLikelihood = ComputeExperimentLogLikelihood(pData, TargetResponse, FeatureResponse,
00844                                                                 NewtonTDeriv, NewtonTGrad, IHash, Weight, i);
00845                 for (ti=i; ti<pData->m_nReplicates[i]; ti++)
00846                 {
00847                         for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++) // generate trial values for each replicate - denser attempts
00848                         {
00849                                 if (FeatureResponse[j]>0)
00850                                         trialval = (pData->m_fPM[ti][j]-pData->m_fMM[ti][j])/(FeatureResponse[j]);
00851                                         //trialval = (pData->m_fPM[nIndex]-pData->m_fMM[nIndex])/(FeatureResponse[j]);
00852                                 else
00853                                         trialval = -1;
00854                                 if (trialval>0)
00855                                 {
00856                                         // set each replicate within the group containing experiment i to the same trial value
00857                                         oldval = TargetResponse[i];
00858                                         for (tti=i; tti<pData->m_nReplicates[i]; tti++)
00859                                                 TargetResponse[tti] = trialval;
00860                                         LogLikelihood = ComputeExperimentLogLikelihood(pData, TargetResponse, FeatureResponse,
00861                                                                                 NewtonTDeriv, NewtonTGrad, IHash, Weight, i);
00862                                         if (LogLikelihood<oldLogLikelihood)
00863                                         {
00864                                                 converged = 0; // obviously found something better
00865                                                 oldLogLikelihood = LogLikelihood; // the new champion
00866                                         }
00867                                         else // reset each replicate to the same old value
00868                                                 for (tti=i; tti<pData->m_nReplicates[i]; tti++)
00869                                                         TargetResponse[tti] = oldval;
00870                                 }
00871                         }
00872                 }
00873                 i = pData->m_nReplicates[i]; // update to next value
00874         }
00875         return(converged);
00876 }
00877 
00878 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00879 
00880 long SearchFeatureGrid(plier_data* pData, double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00881                                            double *NewtonTDeriv, double *NewtonTGrad, double *NewtonFDeriv, double *NewtonFGrad,
00882                                            double **IHash, double **Weight,
00883                                            double epsilon, bool bNoFeatureResponse)
00884 {
00885         long i,j;
00886   //long ti, tti;
00887         double trialval, oldval;
00888         double oldLogLikelihood;
00889         double LogLikelihood;
00890         long converged;
00891         // now do the same for FeatureResponses
00892         converged = 1;
00893         for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures && !bNoFeatureResponse; j++)
00894         {
00895                 oldLogLikelihood = ComputefeatureLogLikelihood(pData, TargetResponse, FeatureResponse,
00896                                                                 NewtonFDeriv, NewtonFGrad, IHash, Weight, j);
00897                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
00898                 {
00899                         // run thru experiments generating trial values
00900                         if (TargetResponse[i]>0)
00901                                 trialval = (pData->m_fPM[i][j]-pData->m_fMM[i][j])/(TargetResponse[i]);
00902                                 //trialval = (pData->m_fPM[nIndex]-pData->m_fMM[nIndex])/(TargetResponse[i]);
00903                         else
00904                                 trialval = -1;
00905                         if (trialval>0)
00906                         {
00907                                 oldval = FeatureResponse[j];
00908                                 FeatureResponse[j] = trialval;
00909                                 LogLikelihood = ComputefeatureLogLikelihood(pData, TargetResponse, FeatureResponse,
00910                                                                         NewtonFDeriv, NewtonFGrad, IHash, Weight, j);
00911                                 if (LogLikelihood<oldLogLikelihood)
00912                                 {
00913                                         converged = 0; // obviously found something better
00914                                         oldLogLikelihood = LogLikelihood; // the new champion
00915                                 }
00916                                 else
00917                                         FeatureResponse[j] = oldval;
00918                         }
00919                 }
00920         }
00921         return(converged);
00922 
00923 }
00924 
00925 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00926 
00927 long SearchGridOptimum(plier_data* pData, double *TargetResponse, double *FeatureResponse,
00928                                            double *NewtonTDeriv, double *NewtonTGrad, double *NewtonFDeriv, double *NewtonFGrad,
00929                                            double **IHash, double **Weight,
00930                                            double epsilon, bool bNoFeatureResponse)
00931 {
00932         //long i,j, ti, tti;
00933         //double trialval, oldval;
00934         //double oldLogLikelihood;
00935         //double LogLikelihood;
00936         long converged,xconverged;
00937 
00938         converged = 1; // assume at optimum
00939         // search plausible grid for better possible optima
00940         // obvious grid placement is determined by TargetResponse values
00941         converged = SearchExperimentGrid(pData,TargetResponse,FeatureResponse,NewtonTDeriv,NewtonTGrad,NewtonFDeriv,NewtonFGrad,IHash,Weight,epsilon, bNoFeatureResponse);
00942         xconverged =converged;
00943         converged = SearchFeatureGrid(pData,TargetResponse,FeatureResponse,NewtonTDeriv,NewtonTGrad,NewtonFDeriv,NewtonFGrad,IHash,Weight,epsilon, bNoFeatureResponse);
00944         if (!xconverged || !converged)
00945                 converged = 0;
00946         return(converged);
00947 }
00948 
00949 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00950 
00951 long CorrectReplicatesSlow(long *NewOrder, long *Replicate, long NumExperiments)
00952 {
00953         // but, what about replicates?
00954         long *TOrder = 0;
00955         long *TRep = 0;
00956         long i,j, ti, tj;
00957 
00958         TOrder = new long [NumExperiments];
00959         if (TOrder == 0)
00960                 return NO_DATAMEM;
00961 
00962         TRep = new long [NumExperiments];
00963         if (TRep == 0)
00964         {
00965                 delete[] TOrder;
00966                 return NO_DATAMEM;
00967         }
00968 
00969         // do n^2 correction for replicates
00970         // which basically is slow, but compared with PLIER iterations is still quick
00971         // quickest writing of code to get something functional
00972         // use OldOrder as scratch space here
00973         j = 0; // start off with nothing
00974         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments; i++)
00975         {
00976                 // start with the current least element
00977                 if (NewOrder[i]>-1)
00978                 {
00979                         // add to new order
00980                         tj =j;
00981                         TOrder[j] = NewOrder[i];
00982                         j++;
00983                         // search rest of list
00984                         for (ti=i+1; ti<NumExperiments; ti++)
00985                         {
00986                                 if (NewOrder[ti]>-1)
00987                                 {
00988                                         // if part of the same replicate group, add here
00989                                         if (Replicate[NewOrder[ti]]==Replicate[NewOrder[i]])
00990                                         {
00991                                                 TOrder[j] = NewOrder[ti]; // next replicate in order
00992                                                 j++;
00993                                                 NewOrder[ti] = -1;
00994                                         }
00995                                 }
00996                         }
00997                         NewOrder[i] = -1; // done this, turn off
00998                         for (; tj<j; tj++)
00999                                 TRep[tj] = j; // set replicate number
01000                 }
01001         }
01002         // replace NewOrder
01003         for (i=0; i<NumExperiments; i++)
01004         {
01005                 NewOrder[i] = TOrder[i];
01006                 Replicate[i] = TRep[i];
01007         }
01008 
01009         delete[] TOrder;
01010         delete[] TRep;
01011         return NO_PLIER_ERROR;
01012 }
01013 
01014 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01015 
01016 long UnScrambleMatrix(plier_data *pData, long *Twist)
01017 {
01018         long lRes = NO_PLIER_ERROR;
01019         double *TmpValue;
01020         long i,j;
01021 
01022         TmpValue = new double [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01023         if (TmpValue==0)
01024                 return(NO_DATAMEM);
01025 
01026         // unscramble PM/MM values to original order
01027         for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01028         {
01029                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01030                 {
01031                         TmpValue[i] = pData->m_fPM[Twist[i]][j];
01032                 }
01033                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01034                 {
01035                         pData->m_fPM[i][j] = TmpValue[i];
01036                 }
01037                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01038                 {
01039                         TmpValue[i] = pData->m_fMM[Twist[i]][j];
01040                 }
01041                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01042                 {
01043                         pData->m_fMM[i][j] = TmpValue[i];
01044                 }
01045                 if (pData->m_fWT!=0)
01046                 {
01047                         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01048                         {
01049                                 TmpValue[i] = pData->m_fWT[Twist[i]][j];
01050                         }
01051                         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01052                         {
01053                                 pData->m_fWT[i][j] = TmpValue[i];
01054                         }
01055                 }
01056         }
01057 
01058         delete[] TmpValue;
01059         return(lRes);
01060 }
01061 
01062 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01063 
01064 long UnScrambleReplicates(plier_data *pData, long *Twist)
01065 {
01066         long lRes = NO_PLIER_ERROR;
01067         long *TmpValue;
01068         long i;
01069 
01070         TmpValue = new long [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01071         if (TmpValue==0)
01072                 return(NO_DATAMEM);
01073 
01074         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01075                 TmpValue[i] = pData->m_nReplicates[Twist[i]];
01076         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01077                 pData->m_nReplicates[i] = TmpValue[i];
01078 
01079         delete[] TmpValue;
01080         return(lRes);
01081 }
01082 
01083 
01084 
01085 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01086 
01087 long SortInputs(plier_data* pData, long *OldOrder)
01088 {
01089         // sort the input data into a more useful format, keeping the old order in the appropriate position
01090         // Treats PMdata and MMdata columns as a single, large number
01091         // must handle ties, due to quantile normalization and possible duplicate values
01092         // i.e. A vs B is handled by A[0]<>B[0], ties broken by A[1]<>B[1], etc
01093         double **TmpMatrix = 0; // hold both PM and MM together
01094         long *NewOrder = 0;
01095         long i,j;
01096         long TmpLength;
01097         long lRes = NO_PLIER_ERROR;
01098 
01099         TmpLength = 2*pData->m_nFeatures;
01100         TmpMatrix = new double * [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01101         if (TmpMatrix == 0)
01102                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01103 
01104         NewOrder = new long [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01105         if (NewOrder == 0)
01106         {
01107                 delete[] TmpMatrix;
01108                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01109         }
01110 
01111         long nFailedAt = -1;
01112         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01113         {
01114                 TmpMatrix[i] = new double [TmpLength];
01115                 if (TmpMatrix[i] == 0)
01116                 {
01117                         nFailedAt = i;
01118                         break;
01119                 }
01120         }
01121         if (nFailedAt != -1)
01122         {
01123                 for (i=0; i<nFailedAt; i++)
01124                         delete[] TmpMatrix[i];
01125                 delete[] TmpMatrix;
01126                 delete[] NewOrder;
01127         }
01128 
01129         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01130                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01131                 {
01132                         TmpMatrix[i][j] = pData->m_fPM[i][j];
01133                         TmpMatrix[i][j+pData->m_nFeatures] = pData->m_fMM[i][j];
01134                 }
01135 
01136         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01137                 NewOrder[i] = i;
01138 
01139         // okay, have set up TmpMatrix
01140         HeapIndexMatrix(TmpMatrix, NewOrder, pData->m_nAnalyses, TmpLength);
01141         // NewOrder now contains a sort of the experiments
01142 
01143         // but the replicates need to be put in correct order!
01144         // i.e. adjacent so that the iterators work
01145         lRes = CorrectReplicatesSlow(NewOrder, pData->m_nReplicates, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01146         if (lRes == NO_PLIER_ERROR)
01147         {
01148                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01149                         OldOrder[NewOrder[i]] = i; // inverse map
01150 
01151 /*              for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01152                         for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01153                         {
01154                                 pData->m_fPM[i][j] = TmpMatrix[NewOrder[i]][j];
01155                                 pData->m_fMM[i][j] = TmpMatrix[NewOrder[i]][j+pData->m_nFeatures];
01156                         }*/
01157                 UnScrambleMatrix(pData,NewOrder); // do the sorting
01158         }
01159         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01160                 delete[] TmpMatrix[i];
01161         delete[] TmpMatrix;
01162         delete[] NewOrder;
01163         return lRes;
01164 }
01165

01167 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01168 
01169 void Zero_DataSheet(plier_datasheet *DataSheet)
01170 {
01171         DataSheet->TargetResponse = 0;
01172         DataSheet->OldTargetResponse = 0;
01173         DataSheet->TDeriv = 0;
01174         DataSheet->TGrad = 0;
01175         DataSheet->TStep =0;
01176         DataSheet->FeatureResponse = 0;
01177         DataSheet->OldFeatureResponse = 0;
01178         DataSheet->FDeriv = 0;
01179         DataSheet->FGrad = 0;
01180         DataSheet->FStep = 0;
01181         DataSheet->IHash = 0;
01182         DataSheet->OldOrder = 0;
01183 
01184         DataSheet->IMinusB = 0;
01185         DataSheet->U = 0;
01186         DataSheet->Weight = 0;
01187 }
01188 
01189 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01190 
01191 long Allocate_DataSheet(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet *DataSheet)
01192 {
01193         long i, nFailedAt;
01194 
01195         DataSheet->TargetResponse = new double [pData->m_nAnalyses]; // experiments
01196         if (DataSheet->TargetResponse == 0)
01197                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01198 
01199         DataSheet->OldTargetResponse = new double [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01200         if (DataSheet->OldTargetResponse == 0)
01201                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01202 
01203         DataSheet->TDeriv = new double [pData->m_nAnalyses]; // direction
01204         if (DataSheet->TDeriv == 0)
01205                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01206 
01207         DataSheet->TGrad = new double [pData->m_nAnalyses]; // how far to go
01208         if (DataSheet->TGrad == 0)
01209                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01210 
01211         DataSheet->TStep = new double [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01212         if (DataSheet->TStep == 0)
01213                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01214 
01215         DataSheet->FeatureResponse = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01216         if (DataSheet->FeatureResponse == 0)
01217                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01218 
01219         DataSheet->OldFeatureResponse = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01220         if (DataSheet->OldFeatureResponse == 0)
01221                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01222 
01223         DataSheet->FDeriv = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01224         if (DataSheet->FDeriv == 0)
01225                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01226 
01227         DataSheet->FGrad = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01228         if (DataSheet->FGrad == 0)
01229                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01230 
01231         DataSheet->FStep = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01232         if (DataSheet->FStep == 0)
01233                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01234 
01235 
01236         DataSheet->IHash = new double * [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01237         if (DataSheet->IHash == 0)
01238                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01239         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01240         {
01241                 DataSheet->IHash[i] = 0;
01242         }
01243 
01244         nFailedAt = -1;
01245         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01246         {
01247                 DataSheet->IHash[i] = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01248                 if (DataSheet->IHash[i] == 0)
01249                 {
01250                         nFailedAt = i;
01251                         break;
01252                 }
01253         }
01254         if (nFailedAt != -1)
01255                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01256 
01257         DataSheet->IMinusB = new double * [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01258         if (DataSheet->IMinusB == 0)
01259                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01260         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01261         {
01262                 DataSheet->IMinusB[i] = 0;
01263         }
01264 
01265         nFailedAt = -1;
01266         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01267         {
01268                 DataSheet->IMinusB[i] = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01269                 if (DataSheet->IMinusB[i] == 0)
01270                 {
01271                         nFailedAt = i;
01272                         break;
01273                 }
01274         }
01275         if (nFailedAt != -1)
01276                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01277 
01278         DataSheet->U = new double * [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01279         if (DataSheet->U == 0)
01280                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01281         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01282         {
01283                 DataSheet->U[i] = 0;
01284         }
01285 
01286         nFailedAt = -1;
01287         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01288         {
01289                 DataSheet->U[i] = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01290                 if (DataSheet->U[i] == 0)
01291                 {
01292                         nFailedAt = i;
01293                         break;
01294                 }
01295         }
01296         if (nFailedAt != -1)
01297                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01298 
01299         DataSheet->Weight = new double * [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01300         if (DataSheet->Weight == 0)
01301                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01302         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01303         {
01304                 DataSheet->Weight[i] = 0;
01305         }
01306 
01307         nFailedAt = -1;
01308         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01309         {
01310                 DataSheet->Weight[i] = new double [pData->m_nFeatures];
01311                 if (DataSheet->Weight[i] == 0)
01312                 {
01313                         nFailedAt = i;
01314                         break;
01315                 }
01316         }
01317         if (nFailedAt != -1)
01318                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01319 
01320         DataSheet->OldOrder = new long [pData->m_nAnalyses];
01321         if (DataSheet->OldOrder == 0)
01322                 return NO_DATAMEM;
01323 
01324         return (0);
01325 }
01326 
01327 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01328 
01329 int Delete_DataSheet(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet *DataSheet)
01330 {
01331         long i;
01332 
01333         if (DataSheet->TargetResponse!=0)
01334         {
01335                 delete[] DataSheet->TargetResponse;
01336                 DataSheet->TargetResponse = 0;
01337         }
01338         if (DataSheet->OldTargetResponse!=0)
01339                 delete[] DataSheet->OldTargetResponse;
01340         if (DataSheet->TDeriv!=0)
01341                 delete[] DataSheet->TDeriv;
01342         if (DataSheet->TGrad!=0)
01343                 delete[] DataSheet->TGrad;
01344         if (DataSheet->TStep!=0)
01345                 delete[] DataSheet->TStep;
01346         if (DataSheet->FeatureResponse!=0)
01347                 delete[] DataSheet->FeatureResponse;
01348         if (DataSheet->OldFeatureResponse!=0)
01349                 delete[] DataSheet->OldFeatureResponse;
01350         if (DataSheet->FDeriv!=0)
01351                 delete[] DataSheet->FDeriv;
01352         if (DataSheet->FGrad!=0)
01353                 delete[] DataSheet->FGrad;
01354         if (DataSheet->FStep!=0)
01355                 delete[] DataSheet->FStep;
01356         if (DataSheet->IHash!=0)
01357         {
01358                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01359                         if (DataSheet->IHash[i]!=0)
01360                                 delete[] DataSheet->IHash[i];
01361                 delete[] DataSheet->IHash;
01362         }
01363         if (DataSheet->IMinusB!=0)
01364         {
01365                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01366                         if (DataSheet->IMinusB[i]!=0)
01367                                 delete[] DataSheet->IMinusB[i];
01368                 delete[] DataSheet->IMinusB;
01369         }
01370         if (DataSheet->U!=0)
01371         {
01372                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01373                         if (DataSheet->U[i]!=0)
01374                                 delete[] DataSheet->U[i];
01375                 delete[] DataSheet->U;
01376         }
01377         if (DataSheet->Weight!=0)
01378         {
01379                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01380                         if (DataSheet->Weight[i]!=0)
01381                                 delete[] DataSheet->Weight[i];
01382                 delete[] DataSheet->Weight;
01383         }
01384         if (DataSheet->OldOrder!=0)
01385                 delete[] DataSheet->OldOrder;
01386         return(0);
01387 }

01391 
01392 void SetWeights(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet &pSheet)
01393 {
01394         long i,j;
01395 
01396         // initialize weights
01397         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01398                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01399                         pSheet.Weight[i][j] = 1.0;
01400         // if weights have been passed in, use them
01401         if (pData->m_fWT!=0)
01402         {
01403                 for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01404                         for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01405                                 pSheet.Weight[i][j] = pData->m_fWT[i][j];
01406         }
01407         // conceivably, there's other weighting that could happen
01408 }

01410 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01411 
01412 void SetPLIERHash(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet &pSheet)
01413 {
01414         long i,j;
01415         // set up hash for glog
01416 
01417         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01418                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01419                         pSheet.IHash[i][j] = 4*pData->m_fPM[i][j]*pData->m_fMM[i][j]; // prepped data for distance
01420 }
01421 
01422 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01423 
01424 void FindDescentDirection(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet &pSheet)
01425 {
01426         long i,j;
01427 
01428                         // handle replicates:  Average Deriv and Grad for all replicates, substitute back
01429                         // then everything steps the same amount
01430                         // i.e. treat replicates as identical copies
01431 // initialize step to zero
01432 memset(pSheet.TStep, 0, pData->m_nAnalyses*sizeof(double));
01433 memset(pSheet.FStep, 0, pData->m_nFeatures*sizeof(double)); 
01434 
01435                         Join_Replicates(pData->m_nReplicates, pSheet.TDeriv, pSheet.TGrad, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01436 
01437                         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01438                         {
01439                                 if (pSheet.TGrad[i]>0) // cut off bad values
01440                                         pSheet.TStep[i] = -pSheet.TDeriv[i]/(pSheet.TGrad[i]); // approximate inverse matrix by inverse diagonal
01441                         }
01442                         for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01443                         {
01444                                 if (pSheet.FGrad[j]>0) // cut off bad values
01445                                         pSheet.FStep[j] = -pSheet.FDeriv[j]/(pSheet.FGrad[j]);
01446                         }
01447         // use logarithmic barrier to avoid actually hitting zero quickly
01448                         ShrinkVector(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.TStep, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->dropmax);
01449                         ShrinkVector(pSheet.FeatureResponse, pSheet.FStep, pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->dropmax);
01450                         if (!pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse)
01451                                 memset(pSheet.FStep, 0, pData->m_nFeatures*sizeof(double)); // no change to feature responses based on data
01452 }
01453 
01454 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01455 
01456 void TryDescent(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet &pSheet)
01457 {
01458         double lambda;
01459 
01460         // back up current location
01461                         pSheet.oldLogLikelihood = pSheet.LogLikelihood;
01462                         TransferVector(pSheet.OldTargetResponse, pSheet.TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01463                         TransferVector(pSheet.OldFeatureResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
01464 
01465                         // try decreasing moves in current direction until succeed
01466                         pSheet.LogLikelihood +=1; //not yet evaluated, but probably worse
01467                         lambda = 2;
01468                         while (pSheet.oldLogLikelihood<pSheet.LogLikelihood && lambda>pData->m_algParams->lambdalimit)
01469                         {
01470                                 lambda = lambda/2;
01471 
01472                                 // restore from backup
01473                                 TransferVector(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.OldTargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01474                                 TransferVector(pSheet.FeatureResponse, pSheet.OldFeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
01475 
01476                                 // take a trial step
01477                                 StepVector(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.TStep, pData->m_nAnalyses, lambda);
01478                                 StepVector(pSheet.FeatureResponse, pSheet.FStep, pData->m_nFeatures, lambda);
01479                                 
01480                                 // see if it did good!
01481                                 pSheet.LogLikelihood = ComputeGlobalLikelihood(pData, pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse,
01482                                         pSheet.TDeriv, pSheet.FDeriv, pSheet.TGrad, pSheet.FGrad, pSheet.IHash, pSheet.Weight, 1);
01483                         }
01484 
01485         // if didn't do any good, put back the way it was before
01486                         if (pSheet.oldLogLikelihood<pSheet.LogLikelihood)
01487                         {
01488                                 // do no harm
01489                                 TransferVector(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.OldTargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01490                                 TransferVector(pSheet.FeatureResponse, pSheet.OldFeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
01491                                 pSheet.LogLikelihood = pSheet.oldLogLikelihood;
01492                         }
01493 }
01494 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01495 
01496 double SumConvergence(double *X, double *Y, long length)
01497 {
01498         double ssq = 0;
01499         long i;
01500 
01501         for (i=0; i<length; i++)
01502                 ssq += (X[i]-Y[i])*(X[i]-Y[i]);
01503         return(ssq);
01504 }
01505 
01506 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01507 
01508 long TestNumericalConvergence(plier_data *pData,plier_datasheet &pSheet)
01509 {
01510         long converged;
01511         //double NumericalLimit = 0.1;
01512         double ssq;
01513         converged = 0;
01514 
01515         // test for numerical convergence between old/new values
01516         // only used when feature responses are fixed
01517         // because of stability issues
01518         ssq = SumConvergence(pSheet.TargetResponse,pSheet.OldTargetResponse,pData->m_nAnalyses);
01519         if (ssq< pData->m_algParams->NumericalConvergenceLimit)
01520         {
01521                 converged = 1;  
01522         }
01523     return converged;
01524 }
01525 
01526 
01527 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01528 
01529 long TryGrid(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet &pSheet)
01530 {
01531         long converged;
01532         TransferVector(pSheet.OldTargetResponse, pSheet.TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01533         TransferVector(pSheet.OldFeatureResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
01534         pSheet.oldLogLikelihood = pSheet.LogLikelihood;
01535         // found at least a local optimum - try other possible minima
01536         converged = SearchGridOptimum(pData, pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse,
01537         pSheet.TDeriv, pSheet.TGrad, pSheet.FDeriv, pSheet.FGrad, pSheet.IHash, pSheet.Weight,
01538         pData->m_algParams->plierconvergence, !pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse);
01539 
01540         pSheet.LogLikelihood = ComputeGlobalLikelihood(pData, pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse,
01541                         pSheet.TDeriv, pSheet.FDeriv, pSheet.TGrad, pSheet.FGrad, pSheet.IHash, pSheet.Weight, 1);
01542 
01543         if (pSheet.oldLogLikelihood<pSheet.LogLikelihood+pData->m_algParams->plierconvergence)
01544         {
01545                 converged = 1; // didn't do any good to find another point
01546                 // test again, because roundoff error can build up if epsilon too small
01547                 if (pSheet.oldLogLikelihood<pSheet.LogLikelihood)
01548                 {
01549                         TransferVector(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.OldTargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01550                         TransferVector(pSheet.FeatureResponse, pSheet.OldFeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
01551                 }
01552         }
01553         else
01554                 converged =0; // it did work to find another point
01555         return(converged);
01556 }
01557 
01558 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01559 long TestConvergence(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet &pSheet)
01560 {
01561         long converged;
01562         converged = 0;
01563 
01564         // are we within the zone where we don't care about likelihood?
01565         if (pSheet.oldLogLikelihood<pSheet.LogLikelihood+pData->m_algParams->plierconvergence)
01566         {
01567                 converged++;
01568                 // can we stop iterating here because numerical convergence reached?
01569                 if (!pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse && pData->m_algParams->fixPrecomputed)
01570                         converged = TestNumericalConvergence(pData,pSheet);
01571                 // if we've reached numerical convergence, or are ignoring it because feature responses still shifting
01572                 // see if we're trapped in a local minimum anywhere
01573                 //computationally expensive, so don't do it if don't need it.
01574                 if (converged)
01575                         converged=TryGrid(pData,pSheet);
01576         }
01577         else
01578                 converged = 0;
01579         return(converged);
01580 }
01581 
01582 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01583 // Y = I-B
01584 // U = glog(Y,H)
01585 // PLIER: "same transformation both sides"
01586 // V = glog (f*t,H)
01587 // PLIER trick: H = 4*I*B
01588 // R = U-V
01589 // minimize Geman-McClure(R) for f>=0, t>=0
01590 
01591 long doPlier(plier_data *pData, plier_datasheet &pSheet, double &output)
01592 {
01593         long count, icount, converged;
01594 
01595         long lRes = NO_PLIER_ERROR;
01596 
01597         // actually do the PLIER iterations
01598 
01599                 count=0;
01600                 icount = 0;
01601                 converged = 0;
01602                 pSheet.LogLikelihood=0;
01603                 pSheet.oldLogLikelihood = 1;
01604 
01605                 SetPLIERHash(pData, pSheet);
01606 
01607                 while(count<pData->m_algParams->plieriteration && converged<1)
01608                 {
01609                         count++;
01610 
01611                         pSheet.LogLikelihood = ComputeGlobalLikelihood(pData, pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse,
01612                                 pSheet.TDeriv, pSheet.FDeriv, pSheet.TGrad, pSheet.FGrad, pSheet.IHash, pSheet.Weight, 0);
01613 
01614                         FindDescentDirection(pData,pSheet);
01615 
01616                         TryDescent(pData,pSheet);
01617 
01618                         converged = TestConvergence(pData,pSheet);
01619                         BalanceFeatureResponse(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_nFeatures);
01620                 }
01621 
01622                 if (count == pData->m_algParams->plieriteration && converged<1)
01623                 {
01624                         lRes = MAXIT_PLIER_REACHED;
01625                 }
01626         return(lRes);
01627 }
01628 
01629 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01630 // Y = I-B
01631 // U = glog(Y,H)
01632 // SEA: :"additive model"
01633 // SEA trick: H = 4*I*B*L (attenuated background)
01634 // V = log(f) + log(t)
01635 // R = U-V
01636 // minimize abs(R) by Median Polish
01637 // Y = I-B
01638 // U = glog(Y,H)
01639 // PLIER: "same transformation both sides"
01640 // V = glog (f*t,H)
01641 // PLIER trick: H = 4*I*B
01642 // R = U-V
01643 // minimize Geman-McClure(R) for f>=0, t>=0
01644 
01645 long NewtonPlier(plier_data* pData, double& output)
01646 {
01647         long lRes;
01648         plier_datasheet pSheet;
01649         double SignalSize;
01650         
01651         output = -1;
01652         Zero_DataSheet(&pSheet);
01653         lRes = Allocate_DataSheet(pData, &pSheet);
01654         if (lRes==NO_DATAMEM)
01655         {
01656                 Delete_DataSheet(pData, &pSheet);
01657                 return(lRes);
01658         }
01659 
01660         // preprocess for stability
01661         SortInputs(pData, pSheet.OldOrder);
01662 
01663         // initialize inputs or retrieve preset feature responses
01664         InitializeVector(pSheet.TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->defaultTargetResponse);
01665         if (pData->m_bUseModel == false)
01666                 InitializeVector(pSheet.FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->defaultFeatureResponse);
01667         else
01668                 TransferVector(pSheet.FeatureResponse, pData->m_fFeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
01669 
01670         // set weights on the individual observations
01671         // perhaps based on feature quality, etc.
01672         SetWeights(pData,pSheet);
01673 
01674         AugmentData(pData->m_fPM, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->augmentation);
01675         AugmentData(pData->m_fMM, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_nFeatures, pData->m_algParams->augmentation);
01676 
01677         // start with SEA for stability!
01678         lRes = doSEA(pData, pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse, pSheet.U, pSheet.Weight, !pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse);
01679         if (lRes != NO_PLIER_ERROR)
01680         {
01681                 Delete_DataSheet(pData, &pSheet);
01682                 return lRes;
01683         }
01684         SignalSize = ComputeSignalSize(pSheet.TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01685 
01686         if (pData->m_algParams->optimization == FULL_MLE)
01687         {
01688                 lRes = doPlier(pData,pSheet, output);
01689                 if (pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse && pData->m_algParams->fixPrecomputed)
01690                 {
01691                   // pretend we're reading in the data just
01692                   // as if we were not fitting feature responses
01693                   // for max-compatibility with one-cel-at-a time 
01694                   pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse=0;
01695                   // do SEA to provide same initial value as if reading in
01696                   InitializeVector(pSheet.TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses, pData->m_algParams->defaultTargetResponse);
01697                   // do not re-initialize feature response, of course!
01698                   lRes = doSEA(pData, pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse, pSheet.U, pSheet.Weight, !pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse);
01699                         lRes = doPlier(pData,pSheet, output);
01700                   pData->m_algParams->fitFeatureResponse=1;
01701 
01702                 }
01703         }
01704 
01705         if (pData->m_algParams->balancetype == IDENTIFY_MEDIAN)
01706                 BalanceMedianFeatureResponse(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse,pData->m_nAnalyses,pData->m_nFeatures);
01707         if (pData->m_algParams->balancetype == IDENTIFY_SIZE)
01708         {
01709                 // SignalSize comes from SEA
01710                 // amplify low end
01711                 BalanceSignalSize(pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse,pData->m_nAnalyses,pData->m_nFeatures,SignalSize);
01712         }
01713 
01714         //TransferVector(pData->m_fTargetResponse, TargetResponse, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01715         ScrambleTransferVector(pData->m_fTargetResponse, pSheet.TargetResponse, pSheet.OldOrder, pData->m_nAnalyses);
01716         TransferVector(pData->m_fFeatureResponse, pSheet.FeatureResponse, pData->m_nFeatures);
01717 
01718         // clean up PM/MM matrix to be polite to further analysis
01719         // note that "data augmentation" is still in effect so everything will have augmentation added
01720         UnScrambleMatrix(pData, pSheet.OldOrder);
01721         UnScrambleReplicates(pData, pSheet.OldOrder);
01722 
01723         // track the overall fit
01724         output = pSheet.LogLikelihood/(pData->m_nAnalyses*pData->m_nFeatures);
01725 
01726         Delete_DataSheet(pData,&pSheet);
01727         return lRes;
01728 }
01729 
01730 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01731 
01732 long Compute_Signed_Residuals(plier_data* pData, long ResidualType)
01733 {
01734         long i,j;
01735 
01736         // just compute signed error for each PM/MM pair currently
01737         // do not count TargetResponse penalty (goes with "TargetResponse" related values)
01738         // do not count FeatureResponse penalty (goes with "FeatureResponse" related values)
01739         // do not do Geman-McClure transformation 
01740         // user can compute weights from raw error values if they like
01741         // signed residuals more useful than unsigned
01742         for (i=0; i<pData->m_nAnalyses; i++)
01743         {
01744                 for (j=0; j<pData->m_nFeatures; j++)
01745                 {
01746                         pData->m_fRS[i][j] = JustError(pData->m_fTargetResponse[i],
01747                                 pData->m_fFeatureResponse[j], 
01748                                 4*pData->m_fPM[i][j]*pData->m_fMM[i][j], 
01749                                 pData->m_fPM[i][j], 
01750                                 pData->m_fMM[i][j], 
01751                                 pData->m_algParams->usemm);
01752 
01753                 }
01754         }
01755         return(NO_PLIER_ERROR);
01756 }
